lines.content: Joules is a personal assistant designed to help users manage tasks and contacts with energy and clarity. Inspired by project Duke, Joules adds a layer of personality and memory, making task management feel more human and intuitive.
Refer to Joules' user guide here: https://joulenergy.github.io/ip/
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Launcher.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Launcher.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below open in a window:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.
AI like ChatGPT and Copilot have been used to generate JavaDoc for some of the functions.

Joules is a personal assistant chatbot designed to help users manage tasks and contacts with energy and clarity. Inspired by project Duke, Joules adds a layer of personality and memory, making task management feel more human and intuitive.
Joules helps you manage your tasks with simple, intuitive commands.
> Words in <> are the parameters to be supplied by the user.
> e.g. in `todo <description>`, `<description>` is a parameter which can be used as `todo math assignment`
Adds a Deadline task with a due date.
Adds an Event task with a scheduled date.
Displays all current tasks with their type of task and status of completion.
Marks a task as done. Task number is 1-indexed.
Marks a task as not done. Task number is 1-indexed.
Deletes the specified task at position number in the task list
Lists tasks that contain the given keyword in their descriptions.
Adds a contact. Contact number must have a country code in front of it.
Deletes the specified contact. Contact index is 1-indexed.
Lists contacts that contain the given keyword in their contact name or number.
Tasks and Contacts are automatically saved locally and reloaded when you restart Joules.
AI like ChatGPT and Copilot have been used to generate JavaDoc for some of the functions.
* Represents a list of items such as tasks or contacts that Joules stores
* and provides methods to manipulate them.
* A {@code ItemList} stores tasks in an internal {@link ArrayList} and allows
* adding, removing, retrieving, counting, and printing tasks.
* Constructs a {@code ItemList} with an initial capacity.
* @param size The initial capacity of the list.
* Adds an item to the item list.
assert item != null : "Cannot add null item to list";
* Removes a item from the item list at the specified position.
* @param num The 1-based index of the item to remove.
assert num > 0 && num <= itemCount() : "Cannot remove an item not in list";
* Retrieves the item at the specified position in the item list.
* @param num The 1-based index of the item to retrieve.
* @return The item at the specified position.
assert num > 0 && num <= itemCount() : "Task index out of bounds for retrieval: " + num;
* Returns the number of items in the item list.
* Returns all items in the list in a formatted string.
* Each item is prefixed with its 1-based index.
* @return Formatted item list string or {@code "None found"}
assert itemCount() >= 0 : "Item count should never be negative";
* Returns a formatted string of all items in this {@code ItemList}
* that satisfy the given predicate. Each matching item is numbered
* in order of appearance. If no items match, the string
* @param matcher A {@link Predicate} used to test whether an item
*                should be included in the results.
* @return A formatted string of matching items, or {@code "None found"}
assert t != null : "Item at index " + i + " should not be null";
* Entry point for the Joules chatbot application.
* This class contains the {@code main} method that starts the chatbot,
* initializes stored tasks, and continuously processes user commands
* until the user exits with the {@code bye} command.
/** User interface for interacting with the chatbot */
private static final Ui UI = new Ui();
/** List of tasks representing the user's task history */
private static final TaskList TASKS = new TaskList(DEFAULT_CAPACITY);
/** List of contacts the user has saved */
private static final ContactList CONTACTS = new ContactList(DEFAULT_CAPACITY);
* Generates a response for the user's chat message.
* This method processes commands such as {@code todo},
* {@code delete}, and {@code list} until the {@code bye} command
* Retrieves matching results for a given search keyword.
* This method processes the {@code find} and {@code findc} commands:

*
  • {@code find} ‚Äì searches tasks for descriptions containing the keyword

*
  • {@code findc} ‚Äì searches contacts for names or numbers containing the keyword
* The results are formatted into a message via the {@link Ui}.
* @param keyword The search term provided by the user; must not be empty.
* @param commands Split user input where the first element specifies
*                 the search target ({@code find} or {@code findc}).
* @return A formatted message listing all matching tasks or contacts.
* @throws JoulesException If the command is unsupported or invalid.
private static String getFindResults(String keyword, String[] commands) throws JoulesException {
assert keyword != "" : "keyword should not be empty";

* @return Feedback message describing the result of the modification.
* @throws JoulesException If the command is invalid or the task number is out of range.
private static String executeChangeAndReturnMessage(int taskNum, String[] commands) throws JoulesException {

* @return The task that was created and stored.
* @throws JoulesException If the input format is invalid or the command is unsupported.

* Handles persistent storage of tasks for the Joules chatbot.
* This class provides static methods to load tasks from a file,
* store individual tasks, and save all tasks to a file.
private static final String BASE_DIR = System.getProperty("user.home") + File.separator + "joules_data";
private static final String PATH_TASKS = BASE_DIR + File.separator + "tasks.txt";
private static final String PATH_CONTACTS = BASE_DIR + File.separator + "contacts.txt";
* Loads tasks from the storage file into the given {@link TaskList}.
* If the file does not exist, it will be created automatically.
* Each line in the file represents a task with the format:
* @param tasks The {@link TaskList} to populate with loaded tasks.
assert PATH_TASKS != null && !PATH_TASKS.trim().isEmpty() : "Storage path must be defined";
assert !(taskDetails[0].isEmpty()) : "Task type should not be empty";
System.out.println("Unable to load unknown task type: " + line);
* Loads contacts from the storage file into the given {@link ContactList}.
* If the file does not exist, it will be created automatically.
* Each line in the file represents a contact with the format:
* @param contacts The {@link ContactList} to populate with loaded contacts.
assert PATH_CONTACTS != null && !PATH_CONTACTS.trim().isEmpty() : "Storage path must be defined";
System.out.println("Unable to load unknown contact type: " + line);
* Appends a single task string to the storage file.
* @param textToAppend The string representation of the task to append.
assert PATH_TASKS != null && !PATH_TASKS.trim().isEmpty() : "Storage path must be defined";
* Appends a single contact string to the storage file.
* The contact is expected to be in the format:
* @param contactToAppend The string representation of the contact to append.
* Saves all tasks in the given {@link TaskList} to the storage file.
* This method overwrites the file contents and writes all tasks
* @param tasks The {@link TaskList} containing tasks to save.
assert tasks.itemCount() >= 0 : "Task count should not be negative";
* Saves all contacts in the given {@link ContactList} to the storage file.
* This method overwrites the file contents and writes all contacts
* @param contacts The {@link ContactList} containing contacts to save.
assert contacts.itemCount() >= 0 : "Contact count should not be negative";
* Handles user interactions for the Joules chatbot.

+ " What can I do for you?";
* Returns the goodbye message with ASCII art when the chatbot exits.
+ " Hope to see you again soon!";

return " I have found these matching tasks:\n" + tasks.getMatchingTaskListString(keyword);

* Returns a message indicating that the specified task has been deleted.

return " Okay, I've removed this task:\n   " + t;

* Represents a contact saved by the user.
* A contact consists of a name and a phone number in the format
* {@code +<country code><number>}. Contacts can be stored persistently
* and matched against keywords for searching.
/** The contact number in international format (+country code + number) */
* Constructs a contact with the specified name and number.
* @param contact The contact number in {@code +<country code><number>} format.
* The contact is serialized as a string in the format
* Returns a string representation of the contact.
* Determines whether this contact matches a given search keyword.
* A match occurs if the keyword (case-insensitive) is contained
* in the contact's name or if it appears in the contact number.
* @param keyword The search keyword to match against.
* @return {@code true} if the contact name or number contains the keyword,
* Represents a list of {@link Contact} objects.
* A {@code ContactList} extends the generic {@link ItemList} base class and
* provides operations specific to managing contacts.
* Constructs an empty {@code ContactList} with the specified initial capacity.
* @param size the initial capacity of the list
* Returns a formatted string of all contacts whose details match the given keyword.
* Each matching contact is numbered in order of appearance.
* If no contacts match, the string {@code "None found"} is returned.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for in contact details.
* @return A formatted string of matching contacts, or {@code "None found"} if none match.
assert keyword != null && !keyword.trim().isEmpty() : "Keyword for matching must be non-empty";

* including its type, status, description, and formatted due date.

* fields for the start and end dates. It can be stored and displayed
* Constructs an {@code Event} with the specified description, start date, and end date.

* @param to The end date of the event.
public Event(String description, LocalDate from, LocalDate to) {
* Returns a string representation of the event task,
* including its type, status, description, and formatted start and end dates.

* Represents a generic task with a description and completion status.
* A {@code Task} is the base class for all types of tasks (e.g., {@link Todo},
* {@link Deadline}, {@link Event}) and provides common functionality such
* as marking as done, unmarking, and returning a string representation.
/** Completion status of the task; true if done, false otherwise */
* Constructs a task with the specified description.
* The task is initially not done.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Returns the status icon representing whether the task is done.
* @return "X" if the task is done, otherwise a single space " ".
return (this.isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Marks the task as not done.
* Returns a string representation of the task.
* The string includes the task's status (done or not) and description.
* Example format: "[X] Finish homework" or "[ ] Read book".
* @return String representing the task's status and description.
* Checks if the task description contains the given keyword, case-insensitive.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for in the description.
* @return true If the keyword appears in the description; false otherwise.
* Returns a string suitable for storage in the persistent file.
* The format includes completion status and description, separated by " | ".
* Example format: "1 | Finish homework" or "0 | Read book".
* @return String representing the task for storage.
* Stores the task in the persistent storage.
* Subclasses must implement this method to define how they are stored.
* Represents a list of {@link Task} objects.
* A {@code TaskList} extends the generic {@link ItemList} base class and
* provides operations specific to managing tasks.
* Constructs an empty {@code TaskList} with the specified initial capacity.
* @param size the initial capacity of the list
* Returns a formatted string of all tasks whose descriptions contain the given keyword.
* Each matching task is numbered in order of appearance.
* If no tasks match, the string {@code "None found"} is returned.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for in task descriptions.
* @return A formatted string of matching tasks, or {@code "None found"} if none match.
assert keyword != null && !keyword.trim().isEmpty() : "Keyword for matching must be non-empty";

* Returns a string representation of the todo task,
* including its type, status, and description.
* @return Formatted string of the todo task.
* Stores the todo task in the persistent storage.
* The task is stored in the format:

* A simple test implementation of {@link Task} used for testing purposes.

* Constructs a {@code TestTask} with the given description.

* For {@code TestTask}, this method is intentionally left empty.
